result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie M Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Case 14CF1489

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is waived. Maintain employment and/or school combination.
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

7 YEARS  IMPRISONMENT      *Consecutive*
  -  4 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

COSTS:  $268.00  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

NOTE:  Regarding issue of bail forfeiture being vacated and bail money being returned to poster, Court advises P. Chapman (poster) to file a motion as Corporation Counsel will need to be involved.
